Racine.Horlick Field: Horlick Field, located on the north side of Racine, Wisconsin, in the United States, is an 5,000-seat football stadium and a baseball park enclosed within stone walls and chain fences. The land for the field was donated by William Horlick, the inventor of malted milk. It was designed in 1907 by Walter Dick, who also designed the North Beach Beach House.
